entry.title: Gamedev Is Not A Crime
entry.content:
Have you ever noticed that there are countless Pong, or Snake, or Froggie clones in the app stores and game stores like Itch.io or Steam ?

The proliferation of those games is taking place because they are the first test games that any aspiring developer starts from. They are the proving grounds for most of us who start experimenting in this wonderfull world and those games will be the first modded works that their developers will work on.

They’re not meant to be full, complete, buggless or anything. The only function they carry is helping a developer learn the ropes. Now, is that all it takes ? Obviously not. I made a Pong clone uning Python classes, one with Pygame, one with GDevelop, one with UPBGE and now I’m working on one in Unity. I find it to be a great tool that allows me as a noob to gauge how good of an understanding I have of various concepts.

I also did that with my programming languages journey. When I would learn to do a new thing in Python, I would then repeat the same thing in C++ or C.

PS I’m trying to get into jQuery these days, without a functioning knowledge of Javascript. This should be illegal…
entry.summary: Have you ever noticed that there are countless Pong, or Snake, or Froggie clones in the app stores and game stores like Itch.io or Steam ?

entry.title: Riding The Red Waves
entry.content:
Sometimes the markets don’t go the way you want them. It’s okay, we’ve all been there. In fact, you MUST get there if you want to reach the moon in due time. Learning to deal with problems and liquidations is one of the most important aspects of trading.

It’s hard to resist the FOMO, but fear not for I will teach you the Art Of Zen in the land of Falling Knives.

I remember one time, I was part of a trading bot beta team, so before each release we’d receive the updated algo to go ahead and try it. So I armed it with my strategy, gave it its marching orders and sent it off to take over the Poloniex markets. Unaware, I looked after it for a bit and went on with my daily chores. Oh boy…

So, back then Poloniex had decent volumes, a nice shitcoin portfolio and an awesome lending market. So I had a trading bot running the markets and a lending bot lending out coins to speculators, it was awesome. But, unbeknownst to me, the trading bot was flawed. It had an issue in its logic. It was illogical.

I came back a few hours later to find 2.5 BTC spread in over 20 shitcoins. It was devastating and painful.

Eventually, and luckily for me, the market recovered and I more than quadrupled those coins in that month. But only because I was lucky. I decided that algos needed to be better overwatched by yours truly and that I should never let one manage the trades on its own.
entry.summary: Sometimes the markets don’t go the way you want them. It’s okay, we’ve all been there. In fact, you MUST get there if you want to reach the moon in due time. Learning to deal with problems and liquidations is one of the most important aspects of trading.

entry.title: History Rhymes, Doesn’t Repeat
entry.content:
I’m not even going to try to pretend that I can make sense of what’s been happening in the last five years. And I don’t mean just Bitcoin.

I mean the “Two Weeks To Flatten The Curve” that drove so many people mad. Three years later and I can see people going completley off the rails.

Conspiracies are everywhere now and “They” control every aspect of life. The smoothbrains have taken over social media, made groups, are lobbying and even have people in national parliaments.

We are prone to let our mental life become invaded by legions of half truths, prejudices, and propaganda. At this point, I often wonder whether or not education is fulfilling its purpose. A great majority of the so-called educated people do not think logically and scientifically.

Can we come out of this rabbit hole of stupidity ?
